resources.string: This application makes phone call requests directly to Twilio\'s communication services, which in turn, will connect you to the destination phone device. At this time, contacts are managed using Google Contacts. \n
Owl Call is offered \"as is\", without warranty or guarantee.

Version: 1.0 
Release date: November 26, 2017 
 
This application is not a Twilio company application, even though it was developed by a Twilio employee, using the Twilio Voice SDK.

Author of Owl Call: Stacy David 
Published by Tiger Farm Press. 
November 26, 2017, California, USA 
 
Server side program set up instructions and Owl Call source: 
https://github.com/tigerfarm/owlvc

This privacy notice discloses the privacy practices used in the Owl Call application. This privacy notice applies solely to information used by the Owl Call application. 
 
--- Information Collection, Use, and Sharing --- 
 
Your Google Contact information (Name, phone number, and phone number type) is read into the application's electronic working memory. Only one Google Contacts phone number, and the related name, is stored on the device at any time. The stored data is encrypted. 
 
Your Google Contacts and Twilio account information is not shared by Owl SMS. Your Google Contact and Twilio account information, are only used in this application, and between the application and the Twilio online services. 
 
The Settings Access Token URL connects you Twilio services. The account is either your account, or an account setup by some else, such as Stacy David, the author of this application. 
 
--- Security --- 
 
The phone numbers you use in Owl Call are either your Google Contact phone numbers or numbers you enter manually. The phone numbers are transmitted between Owl Call and the Twilio services using the encyrpted protocol, HTTPS. 
 
Encryption is used to protect information transmitted online between the applcation and the Twilio services (HTTPS). Information stored on the device is also encrypted.

To use Owl Call, you require access to a pre-configured Twilio account, or your own Twilio account with a voice capable phone number. 
 
Twilio Account Console: http://Twilio.com/console. 
 
For this beta release, you may contact Stacy David, a Twilio Onboarding techincal support engineer, to use his pre-configured account. 
 
To use your own Twilio account, you need to have a server side program to generate an access token. The access token contains a link to another server side program that allows Owl Call to make phone calls. The access token program's URL is enter above. Then click Update. 
 
Server side program set up instructions: 
https://github.com/tigerfarm/owlvc 
 
You can use a free Twilio Trial account with Owl Call, however, take note of the restrictions. For example, you can only make calls to phone numbers you have pre-verified. For more information, search for "How does Twilio's Free Trial work?" 
 
To manage your contacts, for now, use Google Contacts on your smartphone, or from a laptop/desktop computer.
